meanings.definition: The part of the brain that receives and coordinates all the stimuli from the body.
meanings.sent1: The sensorium helps us understand what we feel and see.
meanings.sent2: His sensorium was overwhelmed by the loud noises and bright lights.
meanings.sent3: The sensorium in my head must be on vacation today!
meanings.sent4: Her sensorium was like a busy train station, with signals coming from all directions.
meanings.sent5: In the dark room, his sensorium relied on touch and sound to navigate.

meanings.definition: The sensory apparatus of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The bird's sensorium allowed it to detect even the slightest movement.
meanings.sent2: The cat's sensorium was keen, picking up on the scent of prey from afar.
meanings.sent3: The sensorium of the dog seemed to be on high alert during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: Her sensorium was like a finely tuned instrument, capturing every detail of the environment.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, the sensorium of the deer helped it avoid predators and find food.
